war.model

Class WeatherEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • war.model.WeatherEvent

  • @Entity
public class WeatherEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a weather event that have impacted a seaport
    Since:
    26th Mar. 2013
    Author:
    Guillaume Prevost

            java.lang.Integer year,

            java.lang.String impact,
            java.lang.String consequencesRating,
            java.lang.String consequencesOther,
            java.lang.Boolean responseAdequate,
            java.lang.String changes)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor of WeatherEvent specifying all the fields
        Parameters:
        type: - the type of the weather event
        year: - the year when the weather event happened
        direct: - whether the event had direct or indirect impact
        impact: - the description of the impact of the weather event
        consequencesRating: - the rating of the consequences of the weather event
        consequencesOther: - the other consequences not listed in the rating
        response: - the description of the response to the weather event
        responseAdequate: - whether the response was adequate or not
        changes: - description of the changes implemented after the Weather Event
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • parseConsequenceRating

        public static java.lang.Integer parseConsequenceRating(java.lang.String weatherEventConsequenceString)
                                                throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parses a given string as a consequence rating: 1 = None, 2 = Insignificant, 3 = Moderate, 4 = Major, 5 = Extreme
        Parameters:
        weatherEventConsequenceString: - string corresponding to the rating of a weather event consequence
        Returns:
        the integer corresponding to the rating of the weather event consequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the given string isn't a Integer
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given string correspond to a number out of the range 0-5
